channel.title: üè¢ Institute of Science and Technology Austria on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Institute of Science and Technology Austria on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Marrying Causal Representation Learning with Dynamical Systems for Science
item.description: This study marries causal representation learning with dynamical systems to enable parameter identification in real-world scientific data, unlocking downstream causal analysis for various applications…

item.title: Matrix Denoising with Doubly Heteroscedastic Noise: Fundamental Limits and Optimal Spectral Methods
item.description: Optimal matrix denoising with doubly heteroscedastic noise achieved!

item.title: Neural collapse vs. low-rank bias: Is deep neural collapse really optimal?
item.description: Deep neural collapse, previously believed optimal, is shown suboptimal in multi-class, multi-layer networks due to a low-rank bias, yielding even lower-rank solutions.

item.title: Smoke and Mirrors in Causal Downstream Tasks
item.description: AI for science faces hidden biases in causal inference; this paper reveals these flaws using ant behavior data, introducing ISTAnt benchmark, and provides guidelines for more accurate causal AI.

item.title: The Iterative Optimal Brain Surgeon: Faster Sparse Recovery by Leveraging Second-Order Information
item.description: I-OBS, a novel family of sparse recovery algorithms leveraging second-order information, achieves faster convergence rates for sparse DNNs, validated by large-scale experiments.
